alternate_strategies_for_dynamic_selecti.condition: The cut deviates from the intended path.

strategy_options.description: Reposition the cutting tool to restore alignment and continue the cut accurately.
Place a guide, such as a ruler or stencil, to ensure a straight line.
Reduce speed and focus on more controlled movements to stay on track.

alternate_strategies_for_dynamic_selecti.condition: The cutting tool slips or moves unexpectedly.

strategy_options.description: Apply more pressure to the grip or switch to a tool with a better handle.
Secure the object with a non-slip mat or other stabilizing tool.
Use a different cutting tool that offers more control, like a serrated knife or a smaller blade.

alternate_strategies_for_dynamic_selecti.condition: The user accidentally cuts themselves or risks injury.

strategy_options.description: Stop cutting and assess the situation for potential risks.
Stop and treat the injury to prevent further harm.
Switch to using gloves or other protective equipment to prevent further injury.

alternate_strategies_for_dynamic_selecti.condition: The object being cut shifts during the task.

strategy_options.description: Secure the object with clamps or a non-slip mat.
Move the object into a more stable or accessible position.
Slow the cutting process to ensure more careful control of both the object and tool.

alternate_strategies_for_dynamic_selecti.condition: The blade loses sharpness and struggles to cut effectively.

strategy_options.description: Pause and sharpen the cutting tool to restore its effectiveness.
Switch to a sharper or more appropriate tool for the material.
Use less pressure and rely on a more controlled, precise cutting motion.
